intro: Piratinera panamensis, commonly known as the Panama piratinera, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
